citations.narrative:
The individual identified above has been advertising on the internet at www.minnesotawildlifeconnection.com that his
business is a provider of Wildlife Photography, Artist References and Educational Opportunities. Because a Summer
Days Workshop, open to the paying public, was being advertised for July 7-9, APHIS inspectors made a visit to the facility
on July 7, 2023. Upon arrival at the facility a call was placed to the contact number provided on the website. While waiting
in the vehicle, the APHIS inspectors visually observed 1 wolf, 1 cougar and 1 small mammal. After several minutes the
individual’s daughter approached the vehicle. She stated that her father was not present at the facility. When asked if she
would be able to conduct an inspection with us, she stated that she would not be able to do so as she has no part in that
aspect of the business and that she works as an animal handler. When asked if the Summer Days Workshop was
happening, she stated that it was kicking off in the afternoon. She also stated that her father has a MN DNR license for
native animals, and it is her understanding that he can exhibit animals under that license. APHIS inspectors explained that
photography with wild animals is a regulated activity under the Animal Welfare Act and requires a USDA license.
The individual does not hold a valid USDA Class C exhibitor’s license. The individual had been licensed with the USDA as
a Class C exhibitor however the license (41-C-0122) was revoked.
Per this Section of Regulations, any person operating or intending to operate as an exhibitor must have a valid license
with the USDA.
USDA regulated activities may not be conducted without a USDA license.
The exit interview was conducted by phone with the above mentioned individual.
Additional Inspectors:
DEBRA SIME, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
